simpledb

Class BTreeRootPtrPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpledb.BTreeRootPtrPage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Page

    public class BTreeRootPtrPage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Page
    BTreeRootPtrPage stores the pointer to the root node used in the B+ tree and implements Page Interface that is used by BufferPool
    See Also:
    BufferPool

    • Constructor Detail

      • BTreeRootPtrPage

        public BTreeRootPtrPage(BTreePageId id,
                        byte[] data)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor. Construct the BTreeRootPtrPage from a set of bytes of data read from disk. The format of an BTreeRootPtrPage is an integer for the page number of the root node, followed by a byte to encode the category of the root page (either leaf or internal), followed by an integer for the page number of the first header page
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • setBeforeImage

        public void setBeforeImage()
        Specified by:
        setBeforeImage in interface Page

      • getId

        public BTreePageId getId()
        Description copied from interface: Page
        Return the id of this page. The id is a unique identifier for a page that can be used to look up the page on disk or determine if the page is resident in the buffer pool.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface Page
        Returns:
        the PageId associated with this page.

      • getId

        public static BTreePageId getId(int tableid)
        There is only one instance of a BTreeRootPtrPage per table. This static method is separate from getId() in order to maintain the Page interface
        Parameters:
        tableid - - the tableid of this table
        Returns:
        the root pointer page id for the given table

      • getPageData

        public byte[] getPageData()
        Generates a byte array representing the contents of this root pointer page. Used to serialize this root pointer page to disk. The invariant here is that it should be possible to pass the byte array generated by getPageData to the BTreeRootPtrPage constructor and have it produce an identical BTreeRootPtrPage object.
        Specified by:
        getPageData in interface Page
        Returns:
        A byte array corresponding to the bytes of this root pointer page.

      • createEmptyPageData

        public static byte[] createEmptyPageData()
        Static method to generate a byte array corresponding to an empty BTreeRootPtrPage. Used to add new, empty pages to the file. Passing the results of this method to the BTreeRootPtrPage constructor will create a BTreeRootPtrPage with no valid entries in it.
        Returns:
        The returned ByteArray.
